page.title: 02The Railway Tunnel Watford.
page.content: The railway line from London to Birmingham was built 148 years ago and it goes through Watford. There is a railway tunnel behind our school, Walter de Merton. It was built because the men who owned the land nearby would not let the railway be built across it. Instead, a cutting 21 metres deep and the tunnel had to be made to take the railway across more difficult ground. The tunnel is over a mile long and ten men were killed when they were digging it. It goes under a park, houses, roads and fields. There are ventilation shafts all the way along it.
